question: The r-squared for this model is 0.52 What does it tell you?

answers.answer: Click here to see the answer.
answers.feedback: We can interpret the r-squared as the proportion of the variance in the target variable that can be explained by our model. In this particular case our linear model with the three features can account 'only' for 52% of the variation in our target variable. Nearly half of the variation is still unexplained. That indicates that the model is probably missing some important information (e.g. more features, non-linear relationship...).
